thread.title: Rams run with the Bears at Brewster Invitational
thread.title_full: Rams run with the Bears at Brewster Invitational

author: Dave Stewart
title: Rams run with the Bears at Brewster Invitational
text: By Dave Stewart on October 5, 2015 in FCIAC , High School Sports , Sports , Sports Lead · 0 Comments The New Canaan Rams’ cross country teams took their show on the road to New York state on Saturday, running in the annual Brewster Bear Invitational, which was a bit wetter than usual thanks to Friday’s steady rain. Both teams delivered strong performances, with the girls finishing fourth and the boys finishing sixth in the Div. 2 varsity team results. The New Canaan girls scored 156 points with an average time of 21:20 in their fourth-place finish. John Jay/Cross River won with 35 points, with Briarcliff (71), Mamaroneck (104), New Canaan, and Nyack (169) rounding out the top five. The race featured 13 schools. Sophomore Cali Brannan led the Rams with an 18th-place finish in 20:22.73 on the 4K course, with junior Drew Davis taking 27th place in 20:56.68. Sophomore Leigh Charlton was 38th in 21:43.67, followed by sophomore Chloe McAuliffe (42nd, 21:49.03), junior Megan Waldron (43rd, 21:51.52), sophomore Paulina Cortina (58th, 23:24.92), and junior Rebecca Serven (59th, 23:28.66). Mamaroneck’s Lauren Chapey, a senior, won the race in 17:56.72, with John Jay freshman Pippa Nutali second in 18:30.55, and Briarcliff senior Caroline Pennacchio third in 18:32.96. The New Canaan boys team took sixth place among 15 team, scoring 184 points. The Rams’ average time of 17:49 was the seventh fastest in the race. Host Brewster was first with 77 points, followed by Fox Lane (120), Horace Greeley (145), Harborfields (148), and Irvington (155) in the top five. Ram junior Michael St. George cracked the top 10 in the competitive field, finishing ninth over the 5,000-meter course. He timed in at 16:56.51, just behind a pair of runners from Horace Greeley and Putnam Valley High Schools in New York. Running on his home course, Brewster senior Kevin Hazelwood was the race winner in 15:46.20, more than 11 seconds ahead of runner-up Chris Biondi of Pine Bush, who was second in 15:57.64. New Canaan sophomore Alex Urbahn came through with a great performance, finishing 21st overall in 17:16.18. Next for the Rams were juniors Fausto Cortina and Jake Grigsby, who finished a few seconds apart. Cortina was 47th in 18:11.68, and Grigsby was 49th in 18:14.04. Senior Jack O’Connor was 59th in 18:28.84, followed by sophomore Henry Asker (64th 18:39.54), senior Patrick Blasco (69th, 18:45.31), sophomore Dylan Wietfeldt (81st, 19:02.52). The performance on Saturday followed a tough FCIAC meet last Tuesday, as the New Canaan boys and girls were swept by Ludlowe, Warde and Staples in Waveny Park. The girls fell by scores of 24-31 to Ludlowe, 23-32 to Warde, and 19-38 to Staples, while the boys lost by scores of 27-32 to Ludlowe, 20-43 to Warde, and 15-50 to Staples. In the girls race, Staples senior Hannah DeBalsi, the two-time defending FCIAC champion, won the 4,000-meter race by more than a minute and a half, finishing in 14:32. The next two finishers were from Warde as Gabi Galletta was second in 16:04, and Sarah Radziewicz was third in 16:05. Leading the Rams was Davis, who took sixth place with a time of 16:33. Senior Amanda Dobbin was 11th in 16:55, with Charlton 16th in 17:22. Rounding out New Canaan’s scoring were Brannan, who was 18th in 17:28, and freshman Elizabeth Tedford, who was 20th in 17:31. Also in the top 30 for the Rams were senior Lindsay Miller (22nd, 17:36), McAuliffe (23rd, 17:38), junior Lauren Carlson (25th, 17:45), and freshman Elaina Tiller (29th, 17:53). In the boys’ 5K race, Staples had the top seven finishers, with Chase Gornbein leading the way in first at 16:48. Zakeer Ahmad was second in 16:49, and Brandon Harrington was third in 16:50. St. George was the first Ram, as well as the first non-Staples runner, to cross the finish line, taking eighth place in 17:20. Urbahn was 20th in 18:05, with senior Aidan Buck 23rd in 18:13, Cortina 33rd in 18:53, and Asker finishing off the scoring in 34th place with a time of 18:55. Blasco was 37th in 18:57, followed by junior Jake Grigsby (38th, 19:01), Wietfeldt (42nd, 19:23), senior Ryan McGough (46th, 19:38), and O’Connor (50th, 19:43.) New Canaan’s Drew Davis runs along the trails in Waveny Park during a recent FCIAC cross country meet. — Dave Stewart photo Ram Alex Urbahn leads a group of runners along a straightaway in Waveny Park. — Dave Stewart photo
